fieldData.title: National-level social partners address economic challenges: transport
fieldData.title_nationalLanguage: Ogólnopolscy partnerzy społeczni zajmują stanowisko w sprawie wyzwań dla gospodarki: transport
fieldData.calc_minorCategory: Ensuring business continuity and support for essential services
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: Following the spring outbreak of COVID-19 and hasty implementation of anti-crisis government policies, virtually no social dialogue at the central level has been taking place. The situation became even more tense after an attempted move by the government to limit the autonomy of the Social Dialogue Council (RDS), the central tripartite body see case [PL-2020-13/1158] (https://static.eurofound.europa.eu/covid19db/cases/PL-2020-13_1158.html?utm_source=externalDashboard&utm_medium=powerbi&utm_campaign=covid-19)In late summer the climate started to improve somewhat see case [PL-2020-10/1378] (https://static.eurofound.europa.eu/covid19db/cases/PL-2020-10_1378.html?utm_source=externalDashboard&utm_medium=powerbi&utm_campaign=covid-19) and in late September RDS met for the first time in several months, which resulted in a series of bipartite (employee and employers sides, no government) resolutions on vital issues of the body's interest in the current situation. This entry is about the Resolution no. 87. The subject of the Resolution is public aid to be provided to transport companies.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The Resolution 87 includes number of postulates concerning road, railroad, air and maritime transport. The key postulates made are i.e. as follows: * recognition of public transport (in particular local) as a public service (of general interest);* recognition of transport exclusion as a social issue;* assuming responsibility for bus transport by the state;* integrating the problems of bus transport into climate policy;* reactivation of the Tripartite Team for the Road Transport;* finalisation of the lawmaking process leading to adoption of the Public Transport Act;* public aid rendered to LOT Polish Airlines;* relaxation of measures limiting number of passengers in rail transportation, especially for local operators;* extending coverage of the Anti-Crisis Shield to maritime enterprises.
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: The bipartite resolutions have declaratory power and symbolic meaning only, as government does not have to acknowledge any postulates of social partners expressed in such form.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: The resolution emerged as a result of the social partner's initiative.
